text: Been thinking about live streaming capabilities and living lab. I think a gopro would be a nice compromise in form factor and quality. Many of the models have hdmi out, so similar to the live streaming hdmi capture card, we can get some cheaper ones for living lab space where latency doesn't matter as much.
hmm interesting. are any not a fisheye?
There's different settings. I can look it up.
Gopro hero 5 has linear mode which fixes that live. <https://www.google.com/amp/s/havecamerawilltravel.com/photographer/gopro-fov-linear/amp>

attachments.service_name: Have Camera Will Travel - Reviews & Tips
attachments.title: The GoPro HERO5's New Built-In Fisheye Distortion Correction: Linear FOV
attachments.text: The GoPro HERO5 cameras have a new in-camera feature for something you could only do in post-production before: correcting fisheye in photos and videos.

text: May also be some aftermarket lenses available.

Some seem promising and not too expensive like this one. <http://www.ebay.com/itm/4-35MM-Lens-With-Printing-1-2-3-Inch-10MP-IR-72D-NON-FISHEYE-for-Gopro-4-Camera-/302213023014?hash=item465d4cc526:g:tvIAAOSwgApXCmYj>

attachments.title: 4.35MM Lens With Printing 1/2.3 Inch 10MP IR 72D NON FISHEYE for Gopro 4 Camera
attachments.text: Native Megapixel Support: 10MP. This lens is about 12 degrees wider than the popular 5.4mm lens making it optimal for many platforms, especially on a UAV. It is 0.5g lighter, making it perfect for use on gimbals. | eBay!
